title: How to Make a Genuine Apology

steps.title: Know what you did wrong.
steps.content: Know what you did wrong. Whether it was on purpose or an accident, admit that you did it. People like honesty. [1] X Expert Source Michelle Shahbazyan, MS, MA Life Coach Expert Interview. 18 March 2020. Reader Poll: We asked 600 wikiHow readers whoâ€™ve argued with a loved one, and 59% of them agreed that the best way to show your commitment to rebuilding the relationship is by apologizing and taking responsibility for your actions . [Take Poll]

steps.title: Keep it simple, being careful not to start up a fight, a disagreement, or open up the situation for further discussion or recriminations.
steps.content: Keep it simple, being careful not to start up a fight, a disagreement, or open up the situation for further discussion or recriminations. Stick to the idea of re-establishing a good relationship. This is not the time to work out and dissect events.

steps.title: Be prepared to meet resistance.
steps.content: Be prepared to meet resistance. Be prepared for it to take some time for your apology to be processed. [2] X Expert Source Michelle Shahbazyan, MS, MA Life Coach Expert Interview. 18 March 2020. This may be a long moment, a few minutes, or even days or weeks. Be patient and hopeful. Sometimes apologies have to be repeated. Don't let pride keep you from calling or writing again. The injured party may have trouble calming down, they may remain hurt or angry, and you must persist within reason. It is important to keep follow up messages light and casual. One must understand when to stop the effort as well.

steps.title: It helps to say, "This is a genuine apology, I mean it from the bottom of my heart, I have thought about how wrong I was in that matter, and I hope you will accept my apology.
steps.content: It helps to say, "This is a genuine apology, I mean it from the bottom of my heart, I have thought about how wrong I was in that matter, and I hope you will accept my apology.

steps.title: Be polite.
steps.content: Be polite. An apology will be better accepted if it is sincere.

steps.title: Remind the person of all the fun times that the two of you had together.
steps.content: Remind the person of all the fun times that the two of you had together. For instance, "I am sorry I forgot your birthday after all these years.Your friendship means so much to me I hope you will forgive me."

steps.title: Try not to smile.
steps.content: Try not to smile. Smiling generally expresses happiness but you should be serious. If you want to smile, try to have an apologetic smile.

steps.title: In some situations a small gift may serve as a token of apology.
steps.content: In some situations a small gift may serve as a token of apology. Often people use flowers, or pay for lunch if they are eating together. You might say, "Let me get this check, it's my pleasure." If you know a person's favorite things this can be more personal. Wrap a small gift in attractive paper or bag and bring it with you for your apology; it will serve as a little sweetener to the situation. Or say, let's go to lunch, it would be my treat.

steps.title: Express yourself.
steps.content: Express yourself. Refer to the person, talk about what you have done, and why it won't happen again. Don't say, "I hope." It should NEVER happen again.

steps.title: Don't do it again!
steps.content: Don't do it again! An apology is saying sorry. Sorry means not doing it again. It's supposed to be genuine.

steps.title: In some more complicated situations it may serve better to say, "I will work on this negative quality that I have of bringing things up at the wrong time.
steps.content: In some more complicated situations it may serve better to say, "I will work on this negative quality that I have of bringing things up at the wrong time. I see that it is creating problems for everyone."
